abstract: North Carolina fines Duke Energy $25.1 million for contamination of groundwater by its Sutton Plant near Wilmington; state says it is pursuing much larger action against company for spill of millions of gallons of coal ash from plant on Dan River near Virginia border.
lead_paragraph: State officials say the fine against Duke Energy over coal ash contamination of groundwater is the largest in state history.

headline.main: North Carolina Fines Duke Energy $25.1 Million

snippet: State officials say the fine against Duke Energy over coal ash contamination of groundwater is the largest in state history.

keywords.value: Department of Environment and Natural Resources (NC)
